p: Colombia is considered a hyper-endemic country for DENV, registering more than 147,000 cases of dengue in 2010 [ 16]. The recent arrival of CHIKV in 2014 [ 17, 18] and the subsequent entry of ZIKV [ 19] into the country in 2015 have overwhelmed the Colombian health system [ 20] and have demonstrated the enormous need to improve the clinical definition of the diseases and reduce diagnostic errors [ 10]. Although the criteria for the clinical definition of patients with febrile syndrome because of DENV have been widely explored [ 7, 16], the lack of sufficient facilities to make an accurate viral diagnosis before the arrival of the new arboviruses created a diagnostic gap that has jeopardized the health of patients, even more so when the confirmation of cases, both of CHIKV and ZIKV, is performed by clinical definitions in regions that have already confirmed the circulation of these viruses [ 21, 22].
